column2: ARKANSAS DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: AR

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When daylight begins to fade, you should use your:
column6: parking lights.
column8: low beam headlights.

column2: 2. A driver distraction is anything that:
column4: takes the attention away from driving.
column6: causes excessive concentration while driving.
column8: causes aggressive behavior while driving.

column2: 3. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column6: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 4. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column6: must interrupt
column8: must yield to

column2: 5. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 6. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.
column6: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column8: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.

column2: 7. You should always travel:
column4: at the speed of the vehicle behind.
column6: at the speed limit.
column8: according to weather and road conditions.

column2: 8. When another vehicle is passing you:
column4: stay in your lane and reduce speed.
column6: pull your vehicle as far to the right as possible without leaving the pavement.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain speed unless there is an emergency.

column2: 9. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 10. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: a yield sign.
column8: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 11. A good rule of thumb for drivers sharing the road with a truck is:
column4: it is better to drive to the immediate right of the cab.
column6: if you can’t see the truck driver in their side mirror, they can’t see you.
column8: always try to stay alongside a truck, but never drive right behind it.

column2: 12. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: can not turn left.
column8: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column6: A four-way intersection is ahead
column8: Do not pass

column2: 14. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 15. What do warning signs mean?
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 16. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.
column6: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column8: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.

column2: 17. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: If it's been raining several hours.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.

column2: 18. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: parking lights.
column8: high beam headlights.

column2: 19. If a tire blows out, drivers should:
column6: apply the brake firmly and hold it.
column8: hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.

column2: 20. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column6: possible hazards on roadways.
column8: no passing zones.

column2: 21. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 22. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 23. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: Winding road
column8: Sharp turn to the left

column2: 25. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column8: Construction and maintenance warning.
